      • initialize

        public void initialize(SurfaceTextureHelper surfaceTextureHelper,
                       android.content.Context applicationContext,
                       VideoCapturer.CapturerObserver capturerObserver)
        Description copied from interface: VideoCapturer
        This function is used to initialize the camera thread, the android application context, and the capture observer. It will be called only once and before any startCapture() request. The camera thread is guaranteed to be valid until dispose() is called. If the VideoCapturer wants to deliver texture frames, it should do this by rendering on the SurfaceTexture in |surfaceTextureHelper|, register itself as a listener, and forward the texture frames to CapturerObserver.onTextureFrameCaptured().
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface VideoCapturer

      • startCapture

        public void startCapture(int width,
                         int height,
                         int framerate)
        Description copied from interface: VideoCapturer
        Start capturing frames in a format that is as close as possible to |width| x |height| and |framerate|.
        Specified by:
        startCapture in interface VideoCapturer

      • stopCapture

        public void stopCapture()
        Description copied from interface: VideoCapturer
        Stop capturing. This function should block until capture is actually stopped.
        Specified by:
        stopCapture in interface VideoCapturer

      • switchCamera

        public void switchCamera(CameraVideoCapturer.CameraSwitchHandler switchEventsHandler)
        Description copied from interface: CameraVideoCapturer
        Switch camera to the next valid camera id. This can only be called while the camera is running. This function can be called from any thread.
        Specified by:
        switchCamera in interface CameraVideoCapturer

      • addMediaRecorderToCamera

        public void addMediaRecorderToCamera(android.media.MediaRecorder mediaRecorder,
                                     CameraVideoCapturer.MediaRecorderHandler mediaRecoderEventsHandler)
        Description copied from interface: CameraVideoCapturer
        Add MediaRecorder to camera pipeline. This can only be called while the camera is running. Once MediaRecorder is added to camera pipeline camera switch is not allowed. This function can be called from any thread.
        Specified by:
        addMediaRecorderToCamera in interface CameraVideoCapturer

      • removeMediaRecorderFromCamera

        public void removeMediaRecorderFromCamera(CameraVideoCapturer.MediaRecorderHandler mediaRecoderEventsHandler)
        Description copied from interface: CameraVideoCapturer
        Remove MediaRecorder from camera pipeline. This can only be called while the camera is running. This function can be called from any thread.
        Specified by:
        removeMediaRecorderFromCamera in interface CameraVideoCapturer
